title: Semantik Architect Frame Schema: Scientific / Technical Milestone Event
description:
JSON schema for `event.scientific_milestone` frames used by the Semantik Architect CLI and AW bridge.

The schema describes the normalized payload that will be converted into an internal `ScientificTechnicalMilestoneEventFrame`.

frame_type.description: Canonical frame type identifier. Must be `event.scientific_milestone`.

subject.description: Optional discourse-level subject that the milestone is "about" (e.g. a scientist, organization, theory, or product).

domain_lemmas.description:
High-level scientific / technical domain labels, represented as lemma-like keys.
Examples: ['physics'], ['biology'], ['computer_science'].

topic_keywords.description: Finer-grained topic or phenomenon labels as key strings, e.g. ['radioactivity'], ['special_relativity'], ['dna_structure'].

time.description: Optional time span overriding or supplementing `main_event.time` for high-level summaries.

location.description: Optional location overriding or supplementing `main_event.location`. Typically a place or institution.

related_events.description: Other salient events closely tied to the milestone, such as follow-up experiments, commercialization, or prize/award events.

metrics.description:
Machine-readable indicators associated with the milestone, e.g. citation counts, impact factors, or deployment metrics.
Keys are free-form; values are JSON-serializable.

attributes.description: Generic attribute map for additional structured semantic features (e.g. methodology, instruments).

methodology.description: Labels for methods or experimental designs (e.g. 'double_blind', 'randomized_controlled_trial').

instrument.description: Labels for major instruments or facilities (e.g. 'hadron_collider').

extra.description: Opaque source-specific metadata not interpreted by the core semantics/NLG layer. Use this to carry original IDs, raw fields, or debugging information.

EntityRef.description: Lightweight reference to an entity in the Abstract Wiki knowledge graph or an external source. At least one identifier (`id`, `qid`, or `name`) SHOULD be provided.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the entity (database or graph ID).

name.description: Surface name of the entity in a reference language.

lang.description: Optional BCP-47-like language tag for `name`, e.g. 'en', 'fr'.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the entity reference.

TimeSpan.description: Approximate or exact time span for an event. All fields are optional; callers may encode a single point (`point`) or an interval (`start`/`end`).

start.description: Start of the interval in ISO-8601 form, e.g. '1995-01-01' or '1995-01-01T00:00:00Z'.

end.description: End of the interval in ISO-8601 form.

point.description: Instantaneous timestamp in ISO-8601 form when appropriate.

EventRef.description: Lightweight representation or reference for an event.

id.description: Opaque internal identifier for the event (database or graph ID).

name.description: Short human-readable label for the event.

extra.description: Free-form payload attached to the event reference.
